byline.contributor: Daniel E. Slotnik and Robert Berkvist contributed reporting.

abstract: Gene Wilder, acclaimed American comic actor most well known for his cinematic collaborations with director Mel Brooks, dies at age 83; Wilder's performance in starring role of family classic Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory endeared him to American audiences, along with his onscreen chemistry with co-star Richard Pryor in box-office hit Stir Crazy.

headline.print_headline: Gene Wilder, Star of ‘Young Frankenstein’ and ‘The Producers,’ Dies at 83
headline.main: Gene Wilder Dies at 83; Star of ‘Willy Wonka’ and ‘Young Frankenstein’

snippet: Mr. Wilder’s neurotic comic persona added a special edge to numerous hits, including “Blazing Saddles” and “Stir Crazy.”...
lead_paragraph: Mr. Wilder’s neurotic comic persona added a special edge to numerous hits, including “Blazing Saddles” and “Stir Crazy.”
